resources.string: No workouts found. Create one to get lifting!
No exercises for this day. Click the add exercises button below to add some.
You have a workout currently being created. If you quit now, all progress will be lost!\n\nAre you sure you wish to quit?
You have a workout currently being edited. If you quit now, all progress will be lost!\n\nAre you sure you wish to quit?

There are currently two types of workouts you can create: "fixed" and "flexible". 

Fixed workouts have a fixed number of weeks and days. So for example if you put 4 for the weeks and 4 for the days, there will be 16 days total. 

Flexible workouts allow you to create a workout that only has sequential days. So if you input 20, there will be 20 days in the workout. 

Note that while you can edit the specific exercises and name of a workout after you create it, you cannot alter the number of days in it regardless of the workout type.
Provides a play button next to each exercise in the current workout page that, when clicked, launches a video using the provided URL for the specific exercise.
Converts all units from imperial units (lb) to metric units (kg).
Provides a stopwatch at the bottom of the current workout page.
Provides a timer at the bottom of the current workout page.

Do you wish to restart this workout?

If so, you will be taken back to the first day of the workout with all exercises unchecked. 

The statistics for this workout will be updated using the current workout progress.
Are you sure you wish to permanently delete this workout?\n\nIf so, all statistics for it will also be deleted.
Are you sure you wish to delete this exercise? All data regarding this exercise will be deleted. \n\nNote that deleting it will remove it from already made workouts.
Must contain at least 1 lowercase letter.
Must contain at least 1 uppercase letter.
Must contain at least 1 special character

LiteWeight is an open source lightweight workout manager that allows for multiple workouts to be created and managed. Workouts can be fixed in size either by weeks or sequential days, and can be cycled indefinitely with relevant statistics tracked. 

Default exercises are provided by the developer, and, if desired, you can add your own custom exercises to be used in any workout! All exercises can have a URL associated with them should you wish to be able to view a video on how to perform one while working out. You can also set the most recent amount of weight for specific exercises and this weight will carry over to all your workouts.

All data is saved locally on your phone in a database, and in the future functionality for cloud storage may become available.

Current Workout: Your currently selected workout. You can mark an exercise as done, update the weight of an exercise, or watch the video associated with it if you have that option enabled. When done you can restart the workout and all exercises will be unchecked and you will be brought back to the beginning of the workout. Alternatively, hold down the "Next" button to activate a shortcut to restart the workout from any day. If enabled in the settings page, a timer or stopwatch is provided. These will run in the background as long as the app is not terminated. 

My Workouts: Where all of your workouts are located. The workout at the top is the currently selected one. To switch the current workout, you can select any of your workouts that appear in the list. To create new workouts, click the plus button at the bottom of the page. You can rename, edit, reset statistics, or delete the current workout by clicking the three dots next to the current workout. 

My Exercises: Exercises, both custom and default, are listed in this section, and the weights and URL associated with the exercises can be modified. 

Settings: This section allows for any user settings to be enabled or disabled. These changes will persist upon the closing of the app.
App Logo uses free SVG found here. \n\nDefault Profile Picture was created by Smashicons.
No exercises for this day. Switch modes to add some.

The default weight of this exercise is the weight that will be defaulted to whenever you add this exercise to a new workout or existing one. 

Changing this value will NOT update any weights in existing workouts. To do that, you would have to edit the workout and edit the specific instances of this exercise with the desired weight. 

If enabled in your user settings, this default weight will automatically get updated upon saving or restarting a workout whenever the weight in that workout is higher than the current default weight.

Reps is short for “repetitions” and is the number of times you complete an exercise in a single cycle. This cycle is called a “set”. The default sets and reps are the values that will be defaulted to whenever you add this exercise to a new workout or existing one. \n\nChanging these values will NOT update any sets/reps in existing workouts. To do that, you would have to edit the workout and edit the specific instances of this exercise with the desired sets/reps.

Details are short messages that you can leave for specific exercises to aide in tracking your workouts. Perhaps you may wish to leave a detail that says to only do this exercise with free weights, or only to do this exercise outside. The possibilities are endless. \n\nChanging this value will NOT update this exercise\'s details in existing workouts. To do that, you would have to edit the workout and edit the specific instances of this exercise with the desired details.
You do not yet have any friends added. Click the button below to add some!
You do not have any pending requests.
Please enter the username or email for the account whose password that you wish to reset. A code will be sent to the email associated with that account.
You are not blocking any users. To block a user click the plus button below.
Displays a progress bar in your current workout page showing the percentage of exercises completed in the workout.

LiteWeight is used for creating and tracking custom workouts. The “Current Workout” tab is the tab that contains the workout that you are currently working on. As you cycle through the days you can track which exercises you completed and what weight you used, and then whenever you are ready you can restart the workout to be brought back to day one with all exercises ready to be completed again! After you create a workout you can then share it to any other LiteWeight user.

At this time, you are not able to see specifics of workouts that have already been restarted. The only information you can get would be from your statistics of that workout to see what your average completion percentage is of the workout.

When you share a workout to another user, it makes a copy of the workout at the time of you sharing it. Thus, any changes you make will not be reflected in the copy you sent them. You must send it again for them to get the updated changes.

Whenever you create a new workout or add exercises to an existing workout, the exercises will take the value of the default values specified for that exercise. Changing the values of an exercise, (i.e. weight, sets, reps, details), when they are in a workout will NOT update the default values.\n\nThe only default field that can change from changing it in an existing or new workout is weight. If enabled in your user settings, this default weight will automatically get updated upon saving or restarting a workout whenever the weight in that workout is higher than the current default weight.
Use this form to send any feedback you have about the app. Be it concerns, bugs, or success stories!
